flawed_nl_solution:
In the first week, Jed has 20 + 6 = <<20+6=26>>26 cards.
In the second week, he has 26 + 6 = <<26+6=32>>32 cards.
But he is left with 32 - 2 = <<32-2=30>>30 cards on the 2nd week after giving 2 cards to his friend.
Then Jed has 30 + 6 = <<30+6=63>>63 cards on the 3rd week.
He has 63 + 6 = <<63+6=69>>69 cards on the 4th week.
After giving his friend 2 cards, he is then left with 69 - 2 = <<69-2=67>>67 cards on the 4th week.
#### 4

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 36, not 63. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
